DataElement.preferredName: Lung Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary lung carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to clinical T stage of a lung tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/17/17 tt associated with CS/CSI. 9/13/17 tt transferred context; changed def - 1st letter upper case; changed Reg Status to Qualified. 11/20/11 Retired BCRv1.0 content as part of model cleanup task. 12/16/2011 - unretired CTEP.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lung Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 7 T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  This classification is used for both non-small cell and small cell lung carcinomas and for carcinoid tumors of the lung.  Sarcomas and other rare tumors of the lung are not included. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed, or in which the diagnosis is confirmed by the presence of malignant cells in sputum or bronchial washings, but not visualized by imaging or bronchoscopy. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pTX TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed, or in which the diagnosis is confirmed by the presence of malignant cells in sputum or bronchial washings, but not visualized by imaging or bronchoscopy. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer T4 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer T4 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor of any size that invades any of the following: mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, recurrent laryngeal nerve, esophagus, vertebral body, carina, and separate tumor nodule(s) in a different ipsilateral lobe. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor of any size that invades any of the following: mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, recurrent laryngeal nerve, esophagus, vertebral body, carina, and separate tumor nodule(s) in a different ipsilateral lobe. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer T3 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer T3 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 7 cm or one that directly invades any of the following: parietal pleural (PL3) chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors), diaphragm, phrenic nerve, mediastinal pleura, parietal pericardium; or tumor in the main bronchus (less than 2 cm distal to the carina but without involvement of the carina); or associated atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis of the entire lung or separate tumor nodule(s) in the same lobe. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 7 cm or one that directly invades any of the following: parietal pleural (PL3) chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors), diaphragm, phrenic nerve, mediastinal pleura, parietal pericardium; or tumor in the main bronchus (less than 2 cm distal to the carina but without involvement of the carina); or associated atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis of the entire lung or separate tumor nodule(s) in the same lobe. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer T2b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer T2b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 5 cm but 7 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 5 cm but 7 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer T2a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer T2a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 3 cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 3 cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer T2 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer T2 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 3 cm but 7 cm or less or tumor with any of the following features (T2 tumors with these features are classified T2a if 5 cm or less): Involves main bronchus, 2 cm or more distal to the carina; Invades visceral pleura (PL1 or PL2); Associated with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis that extends to the hilar region but does not involve the entire lung.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 3 cm but 7 cm or less or tumor with any of the following features (T2 tumors with these features are classified T2a if 5 cm or less): Involves main bronchus, 2 cm or more distal to the carina; Invades visceral pleura (PL1 or PL2); Associated with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis that extends to the hilar region but does not involve the entire lung.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer T1b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer T1b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 2 cm but 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 2 cm but 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer T1a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer T1a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor size of 2 cm or less n greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor size of 2 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer T1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer T1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor size of 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor size of 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer without any evidence of a primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer without any evidence of a primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pTis TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

This classification is used for both non-small cell and small cell lung carcinomas and for carcinoid tumors of the lung.  Sarcomas and other rare tumors of the lung are not included.
